name: WHO Well-Being Index
description: A 5-item short self-report measure of current positive psychological well-being. Developed by the World Health Organization and widely used in clinical and research settings.
reference: Topp, C. W., Ostergaard, S. D., Sondergaard, S., & Bech, P. (2015). The WHO-5 Well-Being Index: A systematic review of the literature. Psychotherapy and Psychosomatics, 84(3), 167-176.
instructions: Please indicate for each of the five statements which is closest to how you have been feeling over the last two weeks.

questions.name: who5_1
questions.description: I have felt cheerful and in good spirits

labels.name: more_than_half
labels.label: More than half of the time

labels.name: less_than_half
labels.label: Less than half of the time

questions.name: who5_2
questions.description: I have felt calm and relaxed

labels.name: more_than_half
labels.label: More than half of the time

labels.name: less_than_half
labels.label: Less than half of the time

questions.name: who5_3
questions.description: I have felt active and vigorous

labels.name: more_than_half
labels.label: More than half of the time

labels.name: less_than_half
labels.label: Less than half of the time

questions.name: who5_4
questions.description: I woke up feeling fresh and rested

labels.name: more_than_half
labels.label: More than half of the time

labels.name: less_than_half
labels.label: Less than half of the time

questions.name: who5_5
questions.description: My daily life has been filled with things that interest me

labels.name: more_than_half
labels.label: More than half of the time

labels.name: less_than_half
labels.label: Less than half of the time
